Key Match Events: South Africa defeated India by five wickets in their T20 World Cup match on October 30, 2022.
Suryakumar Yadav scored 68 off 40 balls, lifting India to 133 for nine after a batting collapse.
Lungi Ngidi took four wickets, running through the Indian top-order.
Aiden Markram and David Miller scored 52 and 56 runs respectively, with Miller remaining not out.
South Africa completed the chase in 19.4 overs.
David Miller hit two massive sixes off Ravichandran Ashwin in the 18th over.
Rohit Sharma missed a crucial run-out opportunity against Aiden Markram.
Virat Kohli dropped a catch off Aiden Markram.
Dinesh Karthik walked off the field with an injury, and Rishabh Pant took over as the substitute keeper.
Pre-Game Insights: Temba Bavuma mentioned that South Africa did not consider themselves favorites and aimed to keep improving.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma expressed disappointment in India's fielding, mentioning missed chances and lack of clinical performance.
Rohit Sharma explained his decision to use Ashwin earlier, citing past experiences with spinners in the last over.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a pacy track in Perth, Australia.
The game saw high-pressure moments, including India's defense of 10 runs in the final over.
Weather conditions were not mentioned as a factor affecting the match.
